steps.text:
Holding back the forces of darkness has never been easy, nor safe. Your latest endeavors left you hospitalized in Saint Mary's. You don't regret your daring actions, but the internal bleeding sure makes you wish you'd been more careful.
As the weeks tick by in extended care, you find your mind dwelling greatly on death. Despite the hospital being at the forefront of modern medicine, many patients experience sudden and tragic ends. You thank your lucky stars that your injuries will heal, as your doctors tell you.
But towards the end of your month in Saint Mary's, you find yourself gravely ill. While Dr. Maheswaran will not tell you exactly what's going wrong, the writing's on the wall: your condition has become a matter of life and death. She treads carefully around the topic, but her mousy colleague with the wild eyes treats you like a lost cause.
The remaining moments are a blur. Being wheeled into surgery. Two figures in surgical garb screaming at each other. A sharp, stinging pain. A pair of unsettling emerald eyesâ€¦

<strike><red>Do you hear it? The call is ancient.</red></strike>
<strike><red>A mourning chorus, sung for millennia in all that live and die.</red></strike>
<strike><red>Heed the call. Serve my cause.</red></strike>
<strike><red>It is only a matter of time.</red></strike>
For the remainder of the campaign, the first time you read a block of text that references you reading it (whether or not you were supposed to), resolve that text.
In the app, these sections will be represented with the fancy red border, and a button to acknowledge if you read them.
Each investigator who reads this begins the next scenario with 2 additional resources.
